summary: This document is an email chain between FBI public affairs specialists and a journalist from The Sun regarding the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The journalist inquires about plans to interview Prince Andrew, and the FBI responds that they have no comment and no current plans for such an interview.

persons.name: Amy J. Thoreson
persons.context: FBI Public Affairs Specialist in New York who forwards and responds to a journalist's inquiry about the Prince Andrew/Epstein investigation, stating the FBI has no comment.

persons.name: James Beal
persons.context: Journalist from The Sun who emails the FBI's national press office seeking comment on a story about the FBI intending to interview Prince Andrew as part of the Epstein sex trafficking investigation.

persons.name: Martin R. Feely
persons.context: FBI employee in New York copied on the internal FBI email chain regarding the journalist's inquiry about Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: British royal mentioned as an individual the journalist claims the FBI intends to interview as part of the wider conspiracy investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking operation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the sex trafficking operation investigation that is the subject of the journalist's inquiry and the FBI's internal discussion.

connections.description: Prince Andrew is referenced as an individual the FBI may seek to interview in connection with the investigation into Epstein's sex trafficking operation.
Thoreson, an FBI public affairs specialist, responds to Beal's journalistic inquiry regarding the Prince Andrew/Epstein investigation.
Both are FBI employees in New York; Feely is copied on Thoreson's internal email forwarding the journalist's inquiry.

events.title: Journalist Inquiry to FBI about Prince Andrew
events.description: James Beal of The Sun emails the FBI's national press office seeking comment on a story that the FBI intends to interview Prince Andrew regarding the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking investigation.

events.title: FBI Internal Discussion on Press Inquiry
events.description: FBI Public Affairs Specialist Amy Thoreson forwards the journalist's email internally, noting the 'high profile nature' of the inquiry, and later states the FBI has no comment and no plans to interview Prince Andrew at that point.

locations: London, SE1 9GF (registered office of News Corp UK & Ireland Limited)
keyFacts: A journalist from The Sun contacted the FBI in August 2019 seeking comment on a story that the FBI intended to interview Prince Andrew as part of the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking conspiracy investigation.
The FBI's New York public affairs office, via Amy J. Thoreson, responded that they had no comment on the matter.
An internal FBI email states, 'At this point we don't have plans to interview Prince Andrew,' indicating the inquiry was preliminary or speculative.
The document reveals media interest and FBI internal coordination regarding the high-profile aspect of the Epstein investigation involving Prince Andrew.
The email chain is dated August 16, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
